From HoM^'s Minister, Kabul To Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs-;, India Office (please retransmit to Moscow) Reptdoto Government of India, External Affairs Dept Dated Kabul, 15»00 hours, 30th August 1946 Received 21 * 30 hours, 30th August 1946 IMMEDIATE No,95 - ^2^. Savings te le gram 12 „ I should warmly welcome a visit from Watson* At Termez there is ferry across Oxus* Thence to Mazur~i-Sharif is 35 miles of sand -track ~ riding horse ox'* cart obtainable* From Mazar-i-Sharif there is motor * road to Kabul, Hire of car possible by previous arrangement but very expensive-. People usually travel by postal lorry ~ cheap but most unc omf or table 2.. Major Shah, my Counsellor, hopes to be at Mazar-i-Sharif about Octobe^r 17th and will gladly bring Watson to Kabul, with him if dates^h 1 . Squire 95 August_ jOtn,1 . With the Compliments OF THE Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs ¥6 Foreign Office, CUuf. * 1*'194(5 8 32246—1OUTWARD TELEGRAM No. E 8551/8551/97. [EN CLaIR], DEPARTMENTAL NO. 1 . FROM FOREIGN OFFICE TO KABUL. 26th August 1946. Repeated to: Moscow No. 2800 [Cypher]. W:W:W:W:W Moscow telegram No. 12 to you [of August 21st' proposed visit to Kabul of Mr. Watson]. ^ , I trust that such a visit would be agreeable to you. Please report what arrangements'can be made for journey from frontier to Kabul. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 3114/46 'Miscellaneous telegrams for onward transmission by I.O.'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 22; these numbers are written in pencil and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file mainly consists of assorted telegrams from Moscow to Kabul regarding matters of communication.
